reviews.review:
I'm actually crying, why couldn't Glados stay as a potato? 
It's not fair, I was gonna carry her in my pocket home, and we could be friends still and have nice chats- but no, of course you choose the cyborg life over me.
Can't believe this. I'm so done, Glados.
You didn't even bring cake this time.
Portal 2's coop is really fun with friends, every time we fuck up we laugh in tears. The main game is also fun.

sequel to portal 
this game and portal 1 would be great to add to consoles in like a bundle so that both games can be played on the console Xbox PS4  and Nintendo switch and Google stadia and any console that doesn't have this game and portal 1 i know it will take a while to develop but u can do it on the unreal engine unless u want to port the games as is and put the games on the console store's to buy
Good game, very long, lots of potatoes. 10/10 coins

8.2/10. Better puzzles, better environments, more storytelling, more game. I might maybe love GLaDOS now too. Lots more music that straight up bangs (faith plate I'm looking at you) and all around more cool stuff to look at and mess with. If you liked Portal you'll love Portal 2, and if you haven't played Portal, this is better in every way.

There is a ton of character in this game. Everywhere you visit feels real and detailed, taking a departure from that sterile test chamber feel that was 80% of Portal to get behind the curtain. Portal 2 uses that to its advantage. There is a ton of dialogue (maybe a little too much?), GLaDOS herself somehow got even better. I don't know what they did but she's more than the voice informing you of this next test.

Moving on to the actual puzzles and stuff, there's a lot more of them, and new things to do, but there's a surprising amount of "walk from here to there but you need portals once or twice". It's a great opportunity to fit in some visuals, when you're not busy figuring out a puzzle, but sometimes I didn't even look around since I was busy trying to get to the next area. I got lost more than a few times, as in, I literally didn't know where to put my portal. The zoom feature is very nice but doesn't always make up for portal surfaces being teeny tiny. That and I just didn't see obvious stuff right away, which didn't always sting! Most of the tricky maneuvers you need come up again later on instead of being a one-time solution, so finally getting it stays satisfying instead of frustrating.

I loved the parts where I was on my own, no exit sign, no Wheatley, no prompts to interact with the only thing in the room. Getting to do it on my own was probably the most fun part in this game. I wish more was like that, honestly, because that's what I feel like a Portal game should be all about. Unfortunately, even when you're all alone, the game doesn't give you any time to figure it out before putting a big pop-up that says "USE [E] HERE", which really breaks that "hey look I'm doing it!" feeling. If it's not that, it's Wheatley literally telling you what to do.

Speaking of, Wheatley wouldn't shut up AT ALL EVER. Literally everywhere he could talk to you he had two or three MINUTES of dialogue where he just kept going on and on, and in that style of dialogue that's all "look at me I'm so witty and funny anyway here's exactly what you need to do and it's very obvious but I'm just making sure you know but maybe you're stupid so I just wanted to spell it out for you" that I got very tired of very quickly. They kept GLaDOS mostly the same from Portal, where she would speak like she wasn't chasing a reaction with every word. I much prefer that kind of dialogue, and it's a shame such a major character had none of it.

I haven't tried co-op yet, but I'm sure it's fun. I've played other co-op games so it doesn't really matter how good it is, since they're always fun with friends, but yeah. Just watch someone like Grayfruit play it.
Portal 2 es simple y sencillamente uno de los mejores juegos de PC que he jugado, su simpat√≠a, su variedad y sus puzzles lo hacen un titulo excepcional.

This is one of the great games I've ever played. The realization that the game is 10 years old makes me shudder. Just play it. You will not remain indifferent to puzzles, plot, music and other things, I assure you. If there was no Portal in my childhood, I would most likely be a different person, and I most likely am not the only one
I will gladly shell out money to work with Glados again.

Really really good game. Just everything about it is great. The storyline, the mechanics, the graphics. I like all of it. This game is good for you if you want to have some sci-fi elements along with a puzzle and challenges. And of course portal guns.
se pasa de tranca, pero es piola :v
It's a classic. Can't go wrong
Amazing game. Keep coming back to it.

The storytelling in this game is pretty good, and the levels are really fun, although some of the levels were really hard. Some mechanics were not explained, and things were pretty well hidden, even just to progress to the next levels, which I did not get. Overall, this is a very good game that had me guessing almost every step of the way.

Jump into quantum space hole. Fly out other end. Wheeeeeeeeeeeee.

Actual review: It took me probably about 10 hours to finish the game. The levels range from very hard to very easy. The levels do not require much skill (no super fast reaction times required), but do require you to think (with portals).The last level, however, is time limited, but most levels and interactions are not time limited at all. This is not, however, the type of game that you play a few minutes at a time. It takes anywhere from 5 minutes to 1 hour to complete a level, and after you complete a level, you will want to do more. The story is very good (funny, interesting, unexpected). Also, since its an older game, it gets put on sale, and it'll (probably - not tested) run on integrated graphics just fine.

holy shit what an experience! as someone who doesn't play puzzle games, i got my ass whooped but what an amazing game. valve please come back back to making some great shit like this instead of just putting new skins in CS:GO.
Why are you reading the reviews? This game is awesome, get it.

Absolutely brilliant, love this game.
Really wish there would be a Portal 3 but we'll see...
Really ^^cking fun. Great game only wished that they made it longer and a sequal. I enjoyed it that much.

This game.. ruined my life. Back when I started playing this game I had a girlfriend named Marrisa. But one day while I was playing portal, my pc exploaded and killed her. After she died I was too sad to work causing me to lose my job. After that I became homeless for the next 10 years. Scavenging for scraps, I had to do things I never thought I would have to do to survive. After the 10 years I had gotten ill of the ligma disease. It was then that I decided to pursue science and fix my life whatever the cost. After 10 hard years of college, I finally had the materials needed to build the machine. You see for the last 20 years I had been searching for scraps not just for food, but also parts. You see I had an idea after she died. AND IT WAS TO BRING HER BACK! I stepped into the time machine... To read more the sequel is coming soon. But anyway was pretty good.

I am so GLaD to finally play this game after years of getting the perfect PC to run it as intended.  New challenges and expansion from the first game story,  trusting on your brains  and thinking with portals now is possible to play with a partner in coop mode. what else can i ask for? I can finally die anytime. I regret nothing.
You get yelled at by libertarian while escorting a sentient potato through a giant OSHA violation. 10/10
